text: Lloyd Ashton "Tom" Fallers, Jr. (August 29, 1925 – July 4, 1974) was the A. A. Michelson Distinguished Service Professor in the departments of anthropology and sociology at the University of Chicago. Fallers' work in social and cultural anthropology focused on social stratification and the development of new states in East Africa (especially Buganda) and Turkey. ==References== Category:Social anthropologists Category:Cultural anthropologists Category:American anthropologists Category:American sociologists Category:University of Chicago alumni Category:University of Chicago faculty Category:1925 births Category:1974 deaths Category:People from Nebraska City, Nebraska Category:20th-century anthropologists
title: Lloyd Fallers
